title: Network
description: A telecommunication network. A network consists of a set of nodes interconnected by links.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A universally unique identifier for this network, as defined by [RFC 4122](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4122). For more information, see the [identifier reference](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/identifiers.html).

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description:
Information about the nodes that belong to this network. Information about nodes should be embedded in this field unless:

* The network is too large to load in to memory, in which case a link to a streamable bulk nodes file may be provided in `.relatedResources`
* The data is published via an API and the network is too large to return in a single API response, in which case a link to a paginated nodes endpoint may be provided in `.relatedResources`.

For more information, see [how to format data for publication](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guidance/publication.html#how-to-format-data-for-publication).

links.title: Links
links.description:
Information about the links that belong to this network. Information about links should be embedded in this field unless:

* The network is too large to load in to memory, in which case a link to a streamable bulk links file may be provided in `.relatedResources`
* The data is published via an API and the network is too large to return in a single API response, in which case a link to a paginated links endpoint may be provided in `.relatedResources`.

For more information, see [how to format data for publication](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guidance/publication.html#how-to-format-data-for-publication).

phases.title: Phases
phases.description: Information about the phases in which this network is deployed.

organisations.title: Organisations
organisations.description: Information about the organisations involved in this network. Organisation references elsewhere in the schema are used to refer back to this entries in this list.

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.description: Information about contracts related to this network.

website.title: Website
website.description: The URL of the website for this network.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The organisation that published this network.

publicationDate.title: Publication date
publicationDate.description: The date when this network was published.

collectionDate.title: Collection date
collectionDate.description: The date when the location data was collected. If a dataset was produced by digitising a map, the date that the data for the map was collected.

crs.title: Coordinate reference system
crs.description: The coordinate reference system used in this network. If this network includes any coordinate data (in `Node.location` or `Link.route`) then this field must be provided.

accuracy.title: Accuracy
accuracy.description: The horizontal uncertainty, in metres, of the coordinates in this dataset relative to the datum of the coordinate reference system specified in `crs`. Further details about the accuracy of coordinates in this dataset can be provided in `.accuracyDetails`.

accuracyDetails.title: Accuracy details
accuracyDetails.description: Further details about the accuracy specified in `accuracy`. For example, the confidence level of the accuracy measurement, the methodology used to calculate the accuracy, or a local classification of accuracy.

language.title: Language
language.description: The default language of this network,from the open [language codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#language). A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

relatedResources.title: Related resources
relatedResources.description: References to related resources such as API endpoints or bulk files for nodes and links. References to API endpoints should be provided when a network is too large to return in a single API response. References to bulk files should be provided when a network is too large to load into memory.

Node.title: Node
Node.description: A point within a network. A node may be an access point or may reflect a geographic point at which a link splits, aggregates or crosses a border. Nodes can allow for interconnections to other networks or connections to end users.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this node. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the `nodes` array.

phase.title: Phase
phase.description: The phase to which this node belongs.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of this node, from the closed [nodeStatus codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#nodeStatus).

location.title: Node location
location.description: A GeoJSON [Point](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.4) geometry describing the physical location of this node.

address.title: Node address
address.description: The physical address of this node.

type.title: Node type
type.description: The type of this node, from the open [nodeType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#nodeType).

accessPoint.title: Access point
accessPoint.description: Whether active or passive transmission equipment is installed at this node which is capable of providing access to the network.

internationalConnections.title: International connections
internationalConnections.description: The international connections available at this node. For all connections, `.country` is required.

power.title: Power availability
power.description: Whether power for active network equipment is available at this node.

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.description: The active technologies used at this node, from the open [nodeTechnologies codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#nodeTechnologies).

physicalInfrastructureProvider.title: Physical infrastructure provider
physicalInfrastructureProvider.description: The organisation that owns the passive network infrastructure for this node, i.e. the non-electrical elements, such as dark fibre, ducts and physical sites.

networkProvider.title: Network provider
networkProvider.description: The organisation that operates the active network infrastructure for this node, i.e. the electrical elements, such as optical transceivers, switches and routers. In open business models, network providers provide wholesale access to service providers such as retail internet service providers. Network providers can own or lease the active network infrastructure.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A physical connection between two nodes.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this link. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the `links` array.

phase.title: Phase
phase.description: The phase to which this link belongs.

status.title: Link status
status.description: The status of the network infrastructure for this link, from the closed [linkStatus codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#linkStatus).

readyForServiceDate.title: Ready for service date
readyForServiceDate.description: The date this link was ready to carry traffic.

start.title: Start
start.description: The identifier of one of two nodes that this link connects. If `directed == true` this, represents the starting point of the link. Otherwise the distinction between `start` and `end` is arbitrary.

end.title: End
end.description: The identifier of one of two nodes that this link connects. If `directed == true` this, represents the end point of the link. Otherwise the distinction between `start` and `end` is arbitrary.

directed.title: Directed
directed.description: Whether this link is directed. If `True`, then `.start` represents the start of the link and `.end` represents the end. Otherwise, `.start` and `.end` reference this link's endpoints with no direction implied.

route.title: Link route
route.description: A GeoJSON [LineString](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.4) geometry describing the route of this link.

physicalInfrastructureProvider.title: Physical infrastructure provider
physicalInfrastructureProvider.description: The organisation that owns the passive network infrastructure for this link, i.e. the non-electrical elements, such as dark fibre, ducts and physical sites.

networkProvider.title: Network provider
networkProvider.description: The organisation that operates the active network infrastructure for this link, i.e. the electrical elements, such as optical transceivers, switches and routers. In open business models, network providers provide wholesale access to service providers such as retail internet service providers. Network providers can own or lease the active network infrastructure.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: The organisation responsible for installing the cable for this link.

transmissionMedium.title: Transmission medium
transmissionMedium.description: The physical media of this link, from the closed [transmissionMedium codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#transmissionMedium).

deployment.title: Deployment
deployment.description: The physical deployment of this link, from the closed [deployment codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#deployment). Further details of this link's deployment can be provided in `.deploymentDetails`.

deploymentDetails.title: Deployment details
deploymentDetails.description: Further details of this link's deployment.

darkFibre.title: Dark fibre availability
darkFibre.description: Whether access to dark fibre is available on this link.

fibreType.title: Fibre type
fibreType.description: The type of fibre used in this link, from the closed [fibreType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#fibreType). Further details of the link's fibre type can be provided in `.fibreTypeDetails`.

fibreTypeDetails.title: Fibre type details
fibreTypeDetails.description: Further details about this link's fibre type.

fibreCount.title: Fibre count
fibreCount.description: The number of individual optical fibres in this link.

fibreLength.title: Fibre length
fibreLength.description: The physical length of fibre optic cable used in this link.

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.description: The active technologies used on this link,from the open [linkTechnologies codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#linkTechnologies).

capacity.title: Capacity
capacity.description: The transmission rate, or throughput, of this link, expressed in Gbit/sec (Gbps). The equipped capacity is the total capacity of the circuits (e.g. E1, DS3, STM-1 etc.) which have been activated in the network transmission equipment of the link. Further details of this link's capacity can be provided in `.capacityDetails`.

capacityDetails.title: Capacity details
capacityDetails.description: Further details about this link's capacity

countries.title: Countries
countries.description: The countries in which this link is physically located, from the closed [country codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#country).

Phase.title: Phase
Phase.description: A set of nodes and/or links deployed as a group.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this phase. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the `phases` array.

funders.title: Funders
funders.description: Information about the organizations that provide financing for the development or operation of this phase, also known as investors or financers.

id.title: Local identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this organisation. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the `organisations` array.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which this organization is legally registered, from the closed [country codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#country).

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: This organisation's roles in this network, from the open [organisationRole codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#organisationRole). Further details about this organisation's roles can be provided in `.roleDetails`.

roleDetails.title: Role details
roleDetails.description: Further details about this organisation's roles in the network

website.title: Website
website.description: The URL of the website for this organization.

logo.title: Logo
logo.description: The URL of the logo for this organisation.

Contract.title: Contract
Contract.description: An agreement between the public and private sectors to develop a network.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this contract. The identifier must be unique within the scope of the `contracts` array.

type.title: Contract type
type.description: The type of this contract, from the open [contractType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#contractType).

dateSigned.title: Date signed
dateSigned.description: The date this contract was signed.

documents.title: Contract documents
documents.description: The documents related to this contract.

relatedPhases.title: Related phases
relatedPhases.description: The phases to which this contract relates.

type.title: Type
type.description: The [GeoJSON geometry type](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-1.4) that is described by `.coordinates`, from the closed [geometryType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#geometryType). This must be 'Point' when referenced by `Node.location`, and 'LineString' when referenced by `Link.route`.

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description:
One or more [GeoJSON positions](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.1). For geometries of type 'Point', the coordinates member must be a single position. For geometries of type 'LineString' the coordinates member must be an array of positions.

Each position is an array of numbers with two or more elements.  The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order. Longitude and latitude must be expressed using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84)[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7946#ref-WGS84] datum in units of decimal degrees. Altitude or elevation may be included as an optional third element and must be expressed as the height in meters above or below the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid

Therefore, geometries of type 'Point' must be a single array, e.g. [longitude, latitude], and geometries of type 'LineString' must be an array of arrays, e.g. [[longitude, latitude], [longitude, latitude]].

OrganisationReference.title: Organisation reference
OrganisationReference.description: The local identifier and name of the organisation being referenced. Used to cross-reference to the `organisations` array.

id.title: Local identifier
id.description: The local identifier of the organisation being referenced. This must match the `.id` of an organisation in the `organisations` array.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the organisation being referenced. This must match the `.name` of the organisation in the `organisations` array whose `.id` matches the `.id` of this organisation reference.

PhaseReference.title: Phase reference
PhaseReference.description: The identifier and name of the phase being referenced. Used for cross-referencing.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the phase being referenced. This must match the `.id` of a phase in the `phases` array.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the phase being referenced. This must match the `.name` of the phase in the `phases` array whose `.id` matches the `.id` of this phase reference.

streetAddress.title: Street address
streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which the address is physically located, from the closed [country codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#country).

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of this value, from the closed [currency codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#currency).

Document.title: Document
Document.description: A piece of electronic or physical matter that provides information or evidence or that serves as an official record.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this document. Descriptions should not exceed 250 words. If the document is not accessible online, the description should describe how to access a copy of the document.

url.title: URL
url.description: A web address for accessing this document.

format.title: Format
format.description: The format of this document, from the open [mediaType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#mediaType).

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier assigned to the organisation in the register identified in `.scheme`.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The register from which the identifier in `.id` is drawn, from the open [organisationIdentifierScheme codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#organisationIdentifierScheme).

legalName.title: Legal name
legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organisation

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A canonical URI for this identifier, such as those provided by Open Corporates. Do not use this field to provide the website of the organisation: instead, use `Organisation.website`.

CoordinateReferenceSystem.title: Coordinate reference system
CoordinateReferenceSystem.description: The coordinate reference system used in the data.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the coordinate reference system.

uri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier
uri.description: A URI for the coordinate reference system.

RelatedResourceReference.title: Related resource reference
RelatedResourceReference.description: A reference to a related resource.

href.title: Reference target
href.description: The URL of this related resource.

rel.title: Reference relation type
rel.description: The relationship with this related resource, from the open [referenceRelationType codelist](https://open-fibre-data-standard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#referenceRelationType).

FibreTypeDetails.title: Fibre type details
FibreTypeDetails.description: Further details about a link's fibre type.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this link's fibre type.

DeploymentDetails.title: Deployment details
DeploymentDetails.description: Further details about a link's deployment.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this link's deployment.

CapacityDetails.title: Capacity details
CapacityDetails.description: Further details about a link's capacity.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this link's capacity.
